intro: Sabazia mullerae, commonly known as the Muller's sabazia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and vines. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Sabazia mullerae is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
